Description: Rim sherd (mended from two fragments) of Attic black-figured pottery lip-cup; large, sharp offset on inside; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed below; top of rim glazed; exterior: lip reserved with line at join with wall; ancient repair hole on left; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1888,0601.439.a-b and belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1888,0601.439.c. Hyblesios dedicated similar material at Gravisca.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 416-7, no. B645)
Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 67, no. 854, pl. XXII, no. 854)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 693, no. 502)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0571) (Phase 1)
